basics.name: Jack Xiaoyu Chen
basics.label: Synthetic biologist; PhD in Engineering Science; Bioengineer; Agentic system builder
basics.summary: Director of Molecular Processing and Automation at Aureka Biotechnologies. Specializing in RNA therapeutics, synthetic cells, and AI-driven molecular design.

work.name: Aureka Biotechnologies, Inc.
work.position: Director of Molecular Processing and Automation
work.summary: Leading the design, optimization, and automation of molecular workflows for high-throughput antibody and protein engineering.
highlights: Molecular workflow design: Standardizing DNA/RNA handling, cloning, expression, and QC pipelines
Automation integration: Implementing robotics and liquid-handling systems
Data capture & structuring: Building processes for clean, machine-actionable datasets for AI/ML
Cross-functional coordination with assay, screening, and computational teams

work.name: MEDNA Scientific
work.summary: Driving AI-guided synthetic biology strategies to advance protein design, boost production, and streamline manufacturing pipelines.

work.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology
work.summary: Collins Lab - engineering minicells, RNA therapeutics, and AI-driven molecular design.

work.name: Oxford Suzhou Centre for Advanced Research (OSCAR)
work.summary: Developed a prototype point of care device with a highly sensitive nitric oxide sensor for in-vivo disease diagnosis and large scale high-throughput purification of minicells.

work.name: Susquehanna International Group (SIG)
work.summary: Conducted technical due diligence for an early-stage startup, including in-depth landscape review of major synthetic biology companies. Contributed to guiding investment decisions.

work.name: SynBioUK
work.summary: Student society linking postgraduate researchers in synthetic biology and systems biology across the UK.

work.name: Synced (机器之心)
work.summary: Researched the UK machine learning ecosystem, tracking academic and industrial progress.

volunteer.summary: Selected as one of 100 'leaders of tomorrow' in the biotech industry. Pitched a CrisprCas12/13a-based COVID-19 detection idea.

awards.title: Top 3 in Lingnan Big Data Global Challenge
Best Biology Prize in Biomaker Challenge

publications.name: Autocatalytic base editing for RNA-responsive translational control
Deep generative design of RNA aptamers using structural predictions
Rational Design and Characterization of Nitric Oxide Biosensors in E. coli Nissle 1917 and Mini SimCells
Redesign of ultrasensitive and robust RecA gene circuit to sense DNA damage
